case_vignette: A 7-YEAR-OLD GIRL COMES IN TO THE EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT WITH HER MOTHER FOR SWELLING OF HER LEFT PERIORBITAL REGION. YESTERDAY MORNING SHE WOKE UP WITH A PAINFUL, WARM, SOFT LUMP ON HER LEFT EYELID. EYE MOVEMENT DOES NOT WORSEN THE PAIN. PHYSICAL EXAMINATION SHOWS REDNESS AND SWELLING OF THE UPPER LEFT EYELID, INVOLVING THE HAIR FOLLICLES. UPON PALPATION, THE SWELLING DRAINS PURULENT FLUID.
question: WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING IS THE MOST LIKELY DIAGNOSIS?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a painful, warm, soft lump on my left eyelid, and the eyelid is also red and swollen.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
Since yesterday morning.
Do you have any changes in your vision or any discharge from the eye?
Yes, there is purulent fluid draining from the swelling when it is touched.
Have you had similar symptoms in the past?
No, I haven't had similar symptoms before.
Do you have any known allergies or recent changes in your skincare or makeup products?
I haven't made any recent changes to my skincare or makeup products.
Final Diagnosis: Hordeolum (Stye)
